intro: Onosma ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaved onosma, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
